intro: Mesosphaerum, commonly known as the sand mat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. The plants typically have small, ovate leaves and produce clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. Mesosphaerum species are often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in environments with limited water availability. Due to their resilience and adaptability, they are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
